title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Central Bank Reform Act 2010
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Central Bank Reform Act 2010 

(Sections 20 and 22) (Amendment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited central bank reform act 2010 (sections 20 22) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Central Bank
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Central Bank 
Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011] 
as amended by the Central Bank Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2015 [S.I. No. 545 of 2015].
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean central bank reform act 2010 (sections 20 22) regulation 2011 s.i no 437 2011 amended central bank reform act 2010 (sections 20 22) (amendment) regulation 2015 s.i no 545 2015

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: 4. These Regulations come into operation on 5 October 2020.
text_raw:
4. These Regulations come into operation on 5 October 2020. 

Signed for and on behalf of the CENTRAL BANK OF IRELAND 
 5 October 2020 

ED SIBLEY, 
 Deputy Governor, Prudential Regulation 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [410] 3 

Schedule 

“Schedule 2 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

Part 1 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

in relation to 

All Regulated Financial Service Providers (other than a certified person 
within the meaning of section 55 of the Investment Intermediaries Act 
1995)
text_norm: 4 regulation come operation 5 october 2020 signed behalf central bank ireland 5 october 2020 ed sibley deputy governor prudential regulation notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 9th october 2020 410 3 schedule schedule 2 pre-approval controlled function part 1 pre-approval controlled function relation regulated financial service provider (other certified person within meaning section 55 investment intermediary act 1995)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a body
text_raw:
1. 

In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a body 
corporate incorporated in the State, a person who holds or performs the duties of 
any of the following positions or offices in the regulated financial service 
provider: 

(a) 

the office of: 

(i) 

executive director (PCF-1), 

(ii) non-executive director (PCF-2), 

(b) 

the office of chairman of the board ( PCF-3), 

(c) 

the office of chairman of the audit committee (PCF- 4), 

(d) 

the office of chairman of the risk committee (PCF-5), 

(e) 

the office of chairman of the remuneration committee (PCF-6), 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

the office of chairman of the nomination committee (PCF-7), 

the office of chief executive (PCF-8), 

the office of chief operating officer (PCF-42).
text_norm: 1 case regulated financial service provider body corporate incorporated state person hold performs duty following position office regulated financial service provider (a) office (i) executive director (pcf-1) (ii) non-executive director (pcf-2) (b) office chairman board ( pcf-3) (c) office chairman audit committee (pcf- 4) (d) office chairman risk committee (pcf-5) (e) office chairman remuneration committee (pcf-6) (f) (g) (h) office chairman nomination committee (pcf-7) office chief executive (pcf-8) office chief operating officer (pcf-42)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a partnership
text_raw:
2. 

In the case of a regulated financial service provider that is a partnership 
established in the State, each member of the partnership except limited partners 
within the meaning of section 3 of the Investment Limited Partnerships Act 1994 
(PCF-9).

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In respect of:
text_raw:
1. 

In respect of: 

(a) 

an Insurance Undertaking or a Reinsurance Undertaking within 
the meaning of the European Union (Insurance and Reinsurance) 
Regulations 2015 or the Finance (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 
2015, other than a Captive Insurance Undertaking, a Captive 
Reinsurance Undertaking or a Special Purpose Reinsurance 
Vehicle: 

(i) Head of Underwriting (PCF-18), 

(ii) Head of Investment (PCF-19), 

(iii) Head of Claims (PCF-43), 

(b) 

an Insurance Undertaking or a Reinsurance Undertaking within 
the meaning of the European Union (Insurance and Reinsurance) 
Regulations 2015, other than a Special Purpose Reinsurance 
Vehicle: 

(i) Head of Actuarial Function (PCF-48)

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In respect of a Credit Institution within the meaning of the European
text_raw:
2. 

In respect of a Credit Institution within the meaning of the European 

Union (Capital Requirements) Regulations 2014: 

(a) Head of Treasury (PCF-21), 

(b) Head of Credit (PCF-22), 

(c) Head of Asset & Liability Management (PCF-23) 

(d) Head of Material Business Line (PCF-50) where such a material 
business line satisfies either of the following quantitative criteria: 

(i) 

has gross total assets equal to or in excess of €10 billion; or 

(ii) 

accounts for 10 per cent or more of the credit institution’s 
gross revenue. 

(e) Head of Market Risk (PCF-51) in credit institutions which exceed 

either of the following quantitative criteria1: 

1 As reported in quarterly COREP and FINREP regulatory reporting. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [410] 

(i) 

€500m of market risk (including Credit Valuation 
Adjustment ) Risk Weighted Assets; or 

(ii) €100bn of notional derivatives traded.

heading: In respect of a Market Operator of a Regulated Market within the
text_raw:

In respect of a Market Operator of a Regulated Market within the 
meaning of the European Communities (Markets in Financial Instruments) 
Regulations 2017: 

(a) Head of Traded Markets (PCF-24), 

(b) Head of International Primary Markets (PCF-25), 

(c) Head of Regulation (PCF-26), 

(d) Head of Operations (PCF-27).

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In respect of :
text_raw:
4. 

In respect of : 

(a) 

an Investment Firm within the meaning of the European 
Communities (Markets in Financial Instruments) Regulations 
2017 or an Investment Business Firm authorised or required to be 
authorised under section 10 of the Investment Intermediaries Act 
1995 other than: 

• 

• 

an investment business firm which solely carries on the 
business of an investment product intermediary (within the 
meaning of section 25 of the Investment Intermediaries Act 
1995); or 

an entity authorised or required to be authorised under 
section 10 of the Investment Intermediaries Act 1995 which 
solely carries out: 

➢ 

the administration of collective investment schemes, 
including the performance of valuation services or 
fund accounting services or acting as a transfer agent 
or a registration agent for such schemes; or 

➢ 

custodial operations involving the safekeeping and 
administration of investment instruments; or 

(b) 

an alternative investment fund manager within the meaning of the 
European Union (Alternative Investment Fund Managers) 
Regulations 2013: 

(i) Branch Managers within the State (PCF-28), 

(ii) Head of Trading (PCF-29), 

(iii) Chief Investment Officer (PCF-30) 

(iv) Head of Investment (PCF-31), 

(v) Head of Client Asset Oversight (PCF-45), 

(vi) Head of Investor Money Oversight (PCF-46). 

 
 
 
 5.

an entity authorised or required to be authorised under section 10 
of the Investment Intermediaries Act 1995 which carries out:

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: Act 1997:

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]
heading: In this Part, a reference to UCITS Self Managed Investment Company
text_raw:
9. 

In this Part, a reference to UCITS Self Managed Investment Company 
shall be taken to mean an investment company within the meaning of the 
European Communities (Undertakings for Collective Investment in Transferable 
Securities) Regulations 2011 which has not designated a management company. 

 
 
 
 
 [410] 9 

Part 3 

Pre-Approval Controlled Functions 

in relation to All 

Regulated Financial Service Providers established outside the State
text_norm: 9 part reference ucits self managed investment company shall taken mean investment company within meaning european community (undertakings collective investment transferable securities) regulation 2011 designated management company 410 9 part 3 pre-approval controlled function relation regulated financial service provider established outside state

provider established in a country that is not an EEA country (PCF-41).”

title: Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 22) Regulations 2011 [S.I. No. 437 of 2011]

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Central Bank Reform Act 2010 (Sections 20 and 
22) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 437 of 2011).
